meanings.definition: (Latin) to pile up, heap together; build, construct, erect; form, compose; arrange, draw up; infer, conclude, interpret
meanings.english_definition: (Latin) to pile up, heap together; build, construct, erect; form, compose; arrange, draw up; infer, conclude, interpret

examples.sentence: Construere domum - To build a house
Construere argumentum - To construct an argument
Construere legem - To interpret a law

usage_notes.explanation: Construo is a versatile Latin verb with a range of meanings related to building, arranging, and interpreting. It is essential for understanding Latin literature and philosophy.

readability_explanation.text: This entry describes the Latin verb 'construo,' covering its various meanings related to building, composing, and interpreting. It includes etymological information, pronunciation, inflection, and example sentences to illustrate its usage. Understanding this verb is crucial for reading and interpreting Latin texts.

example_sentences.translation: The soldiers are building a camp.
The orator arranges his sentences elegantly.
The philosopher interprets the world differently.
